result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs, PAC>=0.15 (1st). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs, PAC>=0.15 (1st) was dismissed by the court.

  • Ashley A Krueger was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Ashley A Krueger was found guilty of OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 8:49 AM 
Defendant Ashley A Krueger in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Ashley A Krueger.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Constitutional rights are reviewed; pleas of " GUILTY " entered on Counts #1 and #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Remaining Counts

Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given by Counsel 
Statement made by Ms. Krueger

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--maintain absolute sobriety from all alcohol and non prescribed controlled substances
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid drivers license and Agent approval 
--if permitted to travel out of State, no possession or use of marijuana(THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 

Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be:$518 plus attorney fees].

On Count #3, the Court sentences the Defendant: 

--To serve  60 days   Jail, with Huber privileges, consecutive; to commence on 9/16/22 at 6:00pm 
--Days credit for time already served: 3 days
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process

--To pay fine of $550+ costs= $1731 plus attorney fees.
--DNA sample provision
--Revocation of drivers license for 18 months
--AODA assessment and follow through
--Attendance at a Jefferson County Victim Impact Panel
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 18 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

The Court grants the Defendant a payment plan of $250 per month commencing on 11/1/22 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment will result in 44 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.
recess

[ml] Case called at 8:29AM
Defendant Ashley A Krueger in court with attorney Karl E Huebner. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This file is scheudled for a Preliminary Hearing, however the Defense files waiver paperwrok prior to the case being called. 
The Court proceeds with a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:

Ms. Krueger waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered as to all counts
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

Att Huebner advises that resolution has been acheived, and the Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date sometime in August. The State does not object.

recess 8:34AM

NEXT: Plea and Sentencing on 08/25 at 8:30AM with in person appearances

Order to Seal Victim Key
Preliminary hearing on April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Conditions of this Bond include:
--maintain absolute sobriety
--the Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

[ml] Case called at 1:16PM
[All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Ashley A Krueger appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only; def does not qualify).  ADA Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--maintain absolute sobriety
--the Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

recess 1:23PM

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 04/05 at 8:30AM
